mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jefferson inquires whether or not Short will extend his "odious term of the 4th of April" or return to his place in France; concerns the Te-deum in Paris in honor of the birth of the Duke of Normandy; large numbers of judges, ecclesiastics, and Grand seigneurs; more than General George Washington had in battles of Trenton, Princeton, and Brunswick, NJ; mentions enclosure of letter about L'Orient.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799
Nicetas, of Remesiana, Saint, d. ca. 414--Te Deum laudamus
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1785 April 02, Paris, [France] to W[illiam] S[hort], St. Germain, [France].
